title: I got very less marks in a test. I feel horrible as I'm getting low marks in the same subject, I'm ashamed of myself. How am I going to tell this to my parents? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let’s put it this way. There are elephants, monkeys, cheetahs, mice and every animal you can think of. They are all herded into a zoo and made to do one thing. Climb trees as fast as possible. That’s school. Everybody is different, but marks are given for certain tasks. If marks were given for climbing trees as fast as possible, then the monkeys would do really well. The elephants to pull out the trees - fail. The cheetahs who climb to the middle - they get Bs, Cs. The mice who make holes in the trees - also fail. The birds get to the top faster, but didn’t climb - they get D or F depending on the tutor, sometimes A. Your job at school? Try your best. One day you will find your self worth and what you’re really good at. Maybe you already know.

I think things would only be worse if you didn't let your parents know. Sure their would want to help. Dont/never be ashamed of yourself you got a few low marks it's not the end of the world perhaps have a quiet word with your teacher she should be happy to help you catch up. Let your parents know it will be a weight of you good luck never be ashamed of yourself.
